questions.title: Two Sum
questions.prompt: Given an array of integers nums and an integer target, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to target. Assume exactly one solution and you may not use the same element twice.
followups: What is the time complexity and why?
What edge cases should we consider?

questions.title: Valid Parentheses
questions.prompt: Given a string s containing just the characters '(', ')', '{', '}', '[' and ']', determine if the input string is valid.
followups: Why is a stack the right data structure here?
What is the time complexity?

questions.title: Contains Duplicate
questions.prompt: Given an integer array nums, return true if any value appears at least twice, and return false if every element is distinct.
followups: What is the time and space complexity?
How would you solve this if memory was limited?

questions.title: Palindrome Number
questions.prompt: Given an integer x, return true if x is a palindrome, and false otherwise. Try to avoid converting the number to a string.
followups: How do you handle negative numbers?
What is the complexity of your approach?

questions.title: Majority Element
questions.prompt: Given an array nums of size n, return the majority element (appears more than n/2 times). Assume it always exists.
followups: Explain the Boyerâ€“Moore voting idea.
What's the time and space complexity?

questions.title: Reverse String
questions.prompt: Write a function that reverses a string in-place.
followups: What is the time complexity?
How would you handle Unicode characters?

questions.title: Binary Search
questions.prompt: Given a sorted array and a target value, return the index if found, otherwise return -1.
followups: Why does binary search require sorted data?
What happens with duplicate values?

questions.title: Linked List Cycle
questions.prompt: Given a linked list, determine if it has a cycle.
followups: Explain Floyd's cycle detection algorithm.
What's the time complexity?

questions.title: Valid Anagram
questions.prompt: Given two strings s and t, return true if t is an anagram of s.
followups: What's the time and space complexity?
Can you solve with constant space?

questions.title: First Unique Character
questions.prompt: Given a string s, find the first non-repeating character and return its index.
followups: What's the time and space complexity?
What if the string is very long?

questions.title: Move Zeroes
questions.prompt: Move all zeros in an array to the end while maintaining relative order of non-zero elements.
followups: What's the time complexity?
Can you minimize operations?

questions.title: Missing Number
questions.prompt: Given array nums containing n distinct numbers from 0 to n, find the missing number.
followups: What's the mathematical solution?
What about XOR solution?

questions.title: Reverse Linked List
questions.prompt: Reverse a singly linked list.
followups: What's the iterative approach?
What's the recursive approach?

questions.title: First Bad Version
questions.prompt: Given n versions where version i is bad if version i-1 is good, find first bad version.
followups: Why use binary search?
What about overflow in midpoint calculation?

questions.title: Ransom Note
questions.prompt: Given ransomNote and magazine strings, return true if ransomNote can be constructed from magazine.
followups: What's the time and space complexity?
What if magazine is very large?

questions.title: Single Number
questions.prompt: Given non-empty array where every element appears twice except one, find that single one.
followups: Why does XOR work?
What if numbers appear three times?

questions.title: Happy Number
questions.prompt: A happy number is defined by replacing number with sum of squares of digits until equals 1 or loops.
followups: How to detect cycles?
What's the time complexity?

questions.title: Power of Two
questions.prompt: Given integer n, return true if it is a power of two.
followups: What's the bit manipulation solution?
What about negative numbers?

questions.title: Excel Sheet Column Number
questions.prompt: Given column title as appear in Excel sheet, return corresponding column number.
followups: What's the mathematical formula?
How would you do reverse conversion?

questions.title: Valid Palindrome
questions.prompt: Given string s, determine if it is palindrome considering only alphanumeric characters and ignoring case.
followups: What's the time and space complexity?
Can you solve with constant space?

questions.title: Longest Common Prefix
questions.prompt: Find longest common prefix string amongst array of strings.
followups: What's the time complexity?
What if strings are very long?

questions.title: Remove Duplicates from Sorted Array
questions.prompt: Remove duplicates in-place from sorted array and return new length.
followups: What's the time complexity?
What if array isn't sorted?

questions.title: Maximum Depth of Binary Tree
questions.prompt: Given binary tree, find its maximum depth.
followups: What's the time complexity?
Can you solve iteratively?

questions.title: Invert Binary Tree
questions.prompt: Invert a binary tree (mirror).
followups: What's the time complexity?
Can you solve iteratively?

questions.title: Same Tree
questions.prompt: Given two binary trees, check if they are identical.
followups: What's the time complexity?
Can you solve iteratively?

questions.title: Convert Sorted Array to BST
questions.prompt: Convert sorted integer array to height-balanced BST.
followups: Why is middle element root?
What's the time complexity?

questions.title: Merge Sorted Array
questions.prompt: Merge nums2 into nums1 as one sorted array (nums1 has extra space).
followups: Why merge from end?
What's the time complexity?

questions.title: Pascal's Triangle
questions.prompt: Given numRows, generate first numRows of Pascal's triangle.
followups: What's the mathematical formula?
What if we only need specific row?

questions.title: Length of Last Word
questions.prompt: Given string s consisting of words and spaces, return length of last word.
followups: What's the time complexity?
Can you solve without splitting?

questions.title: Add Binary
questions.prompt: Given two binary strings a and b, return their sum as binary string.
followups: What's the time complexity?
How handle very large strings?

questions.title: Merge Two Sorted Lists
questions.prompt: Given two sorted linked lists, merge them into a single sorted linked list.
followups: What is the time and space complexity?

questions.title: Maximum Subarray
questions.prompt: Find the contiguous subarray with the largest sum and return its sum.
followups: Explain Kadane's algorithm.

questions.title: Climbing Stairs
questions.prompt: You are climbing a staircase with n steps. Each time you can climb 1 or 2 steps. How many distinct ways to reach the top?
followups: How does this relate to Fibonacci?

questions.title: Best Time to Buy Sell Stock
questions.prompt: Given prices where prices[i] is stock price on day i, find maximum profit with one transaction.
followups: What if you could buy and sell multiple times?

questions.title: Palindrome Linked List
questions.prompt: Given a singly linked list, determine if it is a palindrome.
followups: What's the time and space complexity?

questions.title: Implement Queue using Stacks
questions.prompt: Implement a queue using two stacks.
followups: What's the amortized time complexity?

questions.title: Number of 1 Bits
questions.prompt: Write a function that takes unsigned integer and returns number of '1' bits.
followups: What's the time complexity?

questions.title: Counting Bits
questions.prompt: Given integer n, return array of length n+1 where arr[i] = number of 1's in binary representation of i.
followups: What's the DP relation?

questions.title: Plus One
questions.prompt: Given large integer represented as integer array digits, increment and return resulting array.
followups: What's the worst-case scenario?

questions.title: Intersection of Two Arrays
questions.prompt: Given two arrays, return their intersection.
followups: What if arrays are sorted?

questions.title: Remove Element
questions.prompt: Remove all instances of val in-place from array and return new length.
followups: What's the time complexity?

questions.title: Search Insert Position
questions.prompt: Given sorted array and target value, return index if found, otherwise return where it would be.
followups: What's the time complexity?

questions.title: Path Sum
questions.prompt: Given binary tree and target sum, determine if tree has root-to-leaf path summing to target.
followups: What's the time complexity?

questions.title: Balanced Binary Tree
questions.prompt: Determine if binary tree is height-balanced.
followups: What's the time complexity?

questions.title: Best Time to Buy Sell Stock II
questions.prompt: Maximize profit with unlimited transactions (buy and sell multiple times).
followups: Explain greedy approach.

questions.title: Sqrt(x)
questions.prompt: Compute and return square root of x, rounded down to nearest integer.
followups: Why binary search?

questions.title: Range Sum Query Immutable
questions.prompt: Design class to handle multiple range sum queries on immutable array efficiently.
followups: What's the preprocessing time?

questions.title: Middle of Linked List
questions.prompt: Given non-empty singly linked list, return middle node. If two middles, return second.
followups: Explain fast-slow pointer approach.

questions.title: Last Stone Weight
questions.prompt: Simulate game where smash two heaviest stones and continue until one or zero stones remain.
followups: Why use max-heap?

questions.title: Find the Difference
questions.prompt: Given two strings s and t where t is s with one random character added, find added character.
followups: What's the XOR solution?

questions.title: Third Maximum Number
questions.prompt: Return third maximum number in array. If doesn't exist, return maximum.

questions.title: Find All Numbers Disappeared
questions.prompt: Given array nums of n integers where nums[i] in range [1, n], return numbers not in array.

questions.title: Assign Cookies
questions.prompt: Distribute cookies to children with greed factors. Each child gets at most one cookie.

questions.title: Island Perimeter
questions.prompt: Given grid representing island, calculate perimeter of island.

questions.title: Heaters
questions.prompt: Given houses and heaters positions on horizontal line, find minimum radius so all houses covered.

questions.title: Number Complement
questions.prompt: Given positive integer, return its complement (flip bits in binary representation).

questions.title: License Key Formatting
questions.prompt: Format license key string by grouping characters and adding dashes.

questions.title: Max Consecutive Ones
questions.prompt: Given binary array, find maximum number of consecutive 1s.

questions.title: Construct Quad Tree
questions.prompt: Construct quad tree from n x n binary grid.

questions.title: N-ary Tree Preorder
questions.prompt: Return preorder traversal of n-ary tree.

questions.title: To Lower Case
questions.prompt: Implement function to convert string to lowercase.

questions.title: What is API?
questions.prompt: Define what an API is in software engineering.

questions.title: Define JSON
questions.prompt: Explain what JSON is and its role in software systems.

questions.title: Describe OOP
questions.prompt: Describe the main principles of Object-Oriented Programming.

questions.title: REST vs GraphQL
questions.prompt: Compare REST and GraphQL API design approaches.

questions.title: Explain Git
questions.prompt: What is Git and what are its main purposes in software development?

questions.title: What is a Database?
questions.prompt: Define what a database is and why it's important in applications.

questions.title: SQL vs NoSQL
questions.prompt: Compare SQL and NoSQL database types.

questions.title: What is HTTPS?
questions.prompt: Explain what HTTPS is and how it differs from HTTP.

questions.title: Define DNS
questions.prompt: Explain what DNS is and its role in internet infrastructure.

questions.title: What is MVC?
questions.prompt: Explain the Model-View-Controller design pattern.

questions.title: Explain Agile
questions.prompt: What is Agile software development methodology?

questions.title: What is Testing?
questions.prompt: Explain the importance of testing in software development.

questions.title: Define Algorithm
questions.prompt: What is an algorithm in computer science?

questions.title: What is Big O?
questions.prompt: Explain Big O notation and its importance.

questions.title: Explain Recursion
questions.prompt: What is recursion and when is it used?

questions.title: What is a Framework?
questions.prompt: Define what a software framework is.

questions.title: Explain Cloud Computing
questions.prompt: What is cloud computing and its main benefits?

questions.title: Variables
questions.prompt: What is a variable? Explain how variables are used to store and manipulate data.
followups: Can you give an example of a variable in a real program?
What are common bugs related to variables (scope, shadowing)?
How do you choose good variable names?

questions.title: Variable vs Constant
questions.prompt: What is the difference between a variable and a constant? When should you use a constant?
followups: Why do constants improve maintainability?
How do constants relate to immutability?
What's an example of a constant you'd define in an API client?

questions.title: Data Types
questions.prompt: What is a data type? Why do data types matter in programming?
followups: What are examples of common primitive types?
How do types prevent bugs?
What's the difference between static and dynamic typing?

questions.title: Primitive vs Non-Primitive Types
questions.prompt: What are primitive vs non-primitive data types? Give examples and explain differences in memory/storage behavior.
followups: How does pass-by-value vs pass-by-reference relate?
What kinds of bugs come from mutating non-primitive types?
How do arrays/objects behave differently from primitives?

questions.title: Array vs List
questions.prompt: What is the difference between an array and a list (ArrayList/vector/linked list depending on language)? Discuss access, insertion, and memory layout.
followups: Why are arrays often faster due to cache locality?
What happens when a dynamic array grows?
When would a linked list be a better fit?

questions.title: Functions
questions.prompt: What is a function? Why do we use functions, and what makes a function well-designed?
followups: What is a function signature?
What is purity and side effects?
How do you choose function parameters vs global state?

questions.title: Function vs Method
questions.prompt: What is the difference between a function and a method? When does it matter?
followups: What does 'this' / 'self' mean in a method?
How does method overriding relate to polymorphism?
When should behavior live on an object vs be a standalone function?

questions.title: Recursion Basics
questions.prompt: What is recursion? Explain base case vs recursive case, and common recursion pitfalls.
followups: How does recursion relate to the call stack?
What is stack overflow and when can it happen?
Give an example of a naturally recursive problem.

questions.title: Recursion vs Loop
questions.prompt: When would you use recursion instead of a loop? Discuss readability, stack usage, and constraints.
followups: What is tail recursion (and does your language optimize it)?
How do you convert recursion to iteration?
What are the trade-offs for performance?

questions.title: Stack vs Heap Memory
questions.prompt: What is the difference between stack and heap memory? Explain allocations, lifetimes, and typical use-cases.
followups: How does garbage collection relate to heap memory?
What is a memory leak?
How does stack allocation impact performance?

questions.title: Object-Oriented Programming (OOP)
questions.prompt: What is Object-Oriented Programming (OOP)? What problems does it solve, and what are its core principles?
followups: Give a real example where OOP helped.
When might OOP be a poor fit?
How do you choose between OOP and functional style?

questions.title: Four Pillars of OOP
questions.prompt: What are the four pillars of OOP? Define each: encapsulation, inheritance, polymorphism, abstraction.
followups: Which pillar do you use most in real projects and why?
What's a common misuse of inheritance?
How do these pillars relate to maintainable code?

questions.title: Encapsulation
questions.prompt: What is encapsulation? Explain how it helps maintain invariants and reduces coupling.
followups: How is encapsulation different from abstraction?
What does 'private' mean and why is it useful?
Give an example of hiding internal state safely.

questions.title: Inheritance
questions.prompt: What is inheritance? When is it useful, and when should you prefer composition?
followups: What is method overriding?
How can inheritance cause fragile code?
Give an example where composition is better.

questions.title: Polymorphism
questions.prompt: What is polymorphism? Explain how polymorphism improves extensibility with an example.
followups: What's the difference between compile-time and runtime polymorphism?
How do interfaces enable polymorphism?
When can polymorphism hurt performance or clarity?

questions.title: Abstraction
questions.prompt: What is abstraction? Explain how it helps manage complexity by focusing on essential behavior.
followups: How do you design a good abstraction?
What are signs of a leaky abstraction?
Give an example of a clean abstraction you've used.

questions.title: Class
questions.prompt: What is a class? Explain what a class defines and what it typically contains.
followups: What is a field/property vs a method?
How do access modifiers apply?
How does a class relate to a type?

questions.title: Object
questions.prompt: What is an object? Explain object state and behavior with an example.
followups: What is object identity vs equality?
How does mutability affect object state?
How do you avoid unintended shared state?

questions.title: Class vs Object
questions.prompt: What is the difference between a class and an object? Give a concrete example.
followups: How do you create an object from a class?
Can you have multiple objects from the same class?
How does this relate to memory allocation?

questions.title: Constructor
questions.prompt: What is a constructor? When is it called, and what should (and shouldn't) happen inside it?
followups: What are common pitfalls of heavy work in constructors?
How do you handle failures during initialization?
How does dependency injection relate to construction?

questions.title: What Is a Data Structure?
questions.prompt: What is a data structure? Why do data structures matter for performance and maintainability?
followups: Give examples of data structures you've used recently.
How do you choose the right data structure?
How do data structures affect complexity?

questions.title: Array vs Linked List
questions.prompt: What is the difference between an array and a linked list? Compare memory layout and operation costs.
followups: Why are arrays often faster in practice?
What changes if the array is dynamic (vector/ArrayList)?
When is a linked list a good choice?

questions.title: Stack
questions.prompt: What is a stack? Explain LIFO behavior and common use-cases.
followups: How would you implement a stack?
What's the time complexity of push/pop?
Give an example where a stack naturally appears.

questions.title: Queue
questions.prompt: What is a queue? Explain FIFO behavior and common use-cases.
followups: How would you implement a queue efficiently?
What's the time complexity of enqueue/dequeue?
Where do queues appear in systems?

questions.title: Hash Table / Hash Map
questions.prompt: What is a hash table (hash map)? Explain hashing, collisions, and resizing.
followups: What collision strategies do you know?
What's average-case vs worst-case complexity?
What makes a good hash function?

questions.title: Stack vs Queue
questions.prompt: What is the difference between a stack and a queue? Give examples of where each is used.
followups: What real-world process behaves like a queue?
What real-world process behaves like a stack?
How does BFS relate to queues and DFS relate to stacks?

questions.title: Tree
questions.prompt: What is a tree? Explain basic terminology (root, leaf, height) and common traversals.
followups: What's the difference between a binary tree and a BST?
When do you use BFS vs DFS on a tree?
Give an example of a tree problem.

questions.title: Binary Tree
questions.prompt: What is a binary tree? How is it different from a general tree?
followups: What's the difference between a binary tree and a binary search tree?
What are in-order, pre-order, and post-order traversals?
What is the typical complexity of operations in a balanced BST?

questions.title: Graph
questions.prompt: What is a graph? Explain directed vs undirected graphs and common representations.
followups: Adjacency list vs adjacency matrix: when would you choose each?
What's the complexity of BFS/DFS in terms of V and E?
Give a real-world example modeled as a graph.

questions.title: Big-O Notation (Data Structures)
questions.prompt: What is Big-O notation? How do you use it to compare data structure operations?
followups: Give examples: array access, hash map lookup, tree traversal.
How do constants and cache locality matter in practice?
What is amortized analysis?

questions.title: What Is an Algorithm?
questions.prompt: What is an algorithm? Explain how you evaluate correctness and efficiency.
followups: What makes an algorithm correct?
How do you estimate time complexity?
How do you test edge cases?
